data.text:
2019-20 Men's Basketball Roster

Choose a Player:

1 Keandre Cook

Position Guard

Height 6-5

Weight 187

Class Senior

Hometown Baltimore, Md.

Prev School Odessa (Texas) College

Bio

Related

Stats

Historical

Biography

Honors

All-MVC: 2019 (3rd), 2020 (2nd)

MVC All-Newcomer Team: 2019

Preseason All-MVC: 2019-20

MVC Player of the Week: 1/28/19

MVC Newcomer of the Week: 1/28/19, 11/12/18

NABC Hall of Fame Classic All-Tournament Team: 2018

MSU Athletic Director's Honor Roll: Spring 2020

2019-20

Appeared in all 33 games his senior season with 22 starts ... Earned All-MVC second-team honors ... Led squad in scoring (493), 3-pointers (71), 3-point attempts (168), 3-point percentage (.423), minutes (1059), field goals (160), FG attempts (379), free throws (102) and free throw attempts (125) ... Also finished second on the team in steals (28), assists (47) and rebounds (152) ... Ranked 5th in MVC in 3-point FG percentage (.423) and 3-pointers per game (2.2); 6th in scoring (14.9); 9th in free throw percentage (.816); and 12th in minutes per game (32.1) ... Finished two-year career at MSU with 904 points to rank 35th in program history and 6th among two-year players ... Also finished 10th on MSU career 3-pointers list (119) ... Scored in double figures in 26 games as a senior with seven 20-point games ... Led Bears in scoring 13 times ... Notched team-high 26 points vs. Valpo in MVC semifinals, going 8-of-18 from the field with 4 3-pointers and 6-of-6 at the line in final game as a Bear ... Posted 13 points, 5 rebounds and 3 treys in MVC Tourney win over Indiana State (3/6/20) ... Racked up 13 points in return to starting lineup vs. SIU (2/29/20) on senior day ... Knocked down a pair of 3-pointers and scored 12 points at Valpo (2/25/20) ... Posted 21 points in home win over Loyola (2/22/20) with 5 rebounds ... Contributed 13 points in OT loss at Bradley (2/19/20) in 40 minutes ... Scored game-high 19 points in win over Drake (2/12/20) with 5 treys and 5 rebounds ... Dropped 18 points on visiting Illinois State (2/5/20) on 8-of-11 field goals ... Led Bears with 16 points at UNI (1/29/20) with a pair of 3-pointers ... Recorded double-double at Drake (1/26/20) with 12 points, career-high 13 rebounds ... Posted game-high 27 points in win over Valpo (1/23/20) ... Made 25 straight FTs from 11/29/19 to 1/18/20 ... Registered 19 points in win at Evansville (1/18/20) with team-high 4 assists ... Led Bears with 22 points on 6-of-9 shooting with 4 treys vs. Bradley (1/15/20) ... Notched game-high 22 points in win at Illinois State (1/7/20) with 4 triples ... Scored in double figures 11 straight games from 11/10/19 to 12/21/19 ... Registered 12 points and 7 rebounds at VCU (12/15/19) ... ... Drew 3 charges and notched a game-high 17 points in win over Ark State (12/11/19) ... Posted game highs with 20 points and 10 rebounds for his third career double-double in win over MVSU (12/6/19) with 2 dunks ... Scored 9 of his 15 points, including clutch three, in final 1:33 to lead Bears to win over Murray State (12/3/19), including a 7-for-7 effort at the FT line ... Led Bears with 17 points and 3-of-5 3-pointers at LSU (11/29/19) ... Led all players in the field at the Charleston Classic with 7 steals ... Scored 17 points with 4 assists in 40-minutes vs. Buffalo (11/24/19) in Charleston ... Dropped 18 points on St. Joseph’s (11/22/19) in Charleston Classic with 8 rebounds, 3 assists and career-high 5 steals ... Tallied 12 points vs. Miami in Charleston Classic first round (11/21/19) ... Notched team-high 13 points and 4 rebounds at #21 Xavier (11/15/19) ... Produced 19 points and 9 rebounds in win over Cleveland State (11/12/19) ... Posted career-high 31 points in win over Alabama State (11/10/19) on 9-of-13 shooting, 6-of-7 from three, and 7-of-7 at the line ... Preseason All-MVC second-team pick ... Earned MSU Athletic Director's Honor Roll status for spring 2020 semester.

2018-19

Earned All-MVC third-team honors as a junior while also earning a spot on the MVC All-Newcomer Team ... Posted 23 double-figure scoring games and five 20-point games (both tied for team high) ... Led MSU in scoring in (team-best) 11 games and was club’s top rebounder in 10 games ... Ranked 14th in the MVC in scoring (12.8 ppg) ... In MVC games only, he averaged 1.7 3-pointers and 32.0 minutes per game, which ranked 10th and 13th, respectively, in the MVC ... Had team-high 7 rebounds in season finale vs. Bradley (3/8/19) at MVC Tourney ... Scored 10 points and blocked 3 shots vs. Drake (3/2/19) ... Poured in team-high 16 points at Illinois State (2/27/19) with 4 treys ... Logged 11 points in home win over Indiana State (2/23/19) with a pair of threes ... Had team-best 18 points on 7-of-9 shooting in win at Loyola (2/17/19) ... Pulled down game-high 10 rebounds in home win over Illinois State (2/10/19) ... Scored in double figures for the 7th straight game with 12 points and 3 treys in home win over SIU (2/6/19) ... Contributed 15 points and 5 rebounds at UNI (2/2/19) on 5-of-11 shooting with a pair of threes ... Posted game-high 17 points in overtime win at Valparaiso (1/29/19) with 5 rebounds in 41-minute assignment ... Named MVC Player of the Week and Newcomer of the Week on Jan. 28 after his role in leading MSU to a 2-0 home stand with wins over Loyola and Bradley ... Was also named College Sports Madness National High Major Player of the Week on Jan. 28 ... Notched a double-double with game highs 16 points , 10 rebounds and 4 steals in win over Bradley (1/26/19) ... Led Bears with 21 points on 8-of-12 shooting with 5 threes and 8 rebounds in home win over Loyola (1/23/19) ... Had 11 points in a 16-minute stint at Drake (1/20/19) ... Shared team-high scoring honors vs. Evansville (1/16/19) with 14 points ... Posted 13 points in road win at Indiana State (1/8/19) ... Shared team-high scoring honors with 15 points in MVC debut at Southern Illinois (1/2/19) with 3 treys ... Went 7-for-9 from the field and 2-for-2 from long range in home win over UAPB (12/22/18) with 3 steals ... Posted game-high 18 points at Arkansas State (12/18/18) behind 5-of-8 shooting effort ... Had 10 points in first start of the month of December -- at North Dakota State (12/15/18) -- with team-high 6 rebounds ... Provided 15 points off the bench in win over Western Kentucky (12/5/18) ... Tallied 13 points off the bench at Air Force (11/28/18) while going 7-for-7 at the foul line ... Earned All-Tournament honors at Hall of Fame Classic in Kansas City ... Posted his fourth straight 20-point effort, producing 21 points vs. USC (11/20/18) with 5 points and 3 assists ... Dropped 22 points on No. 24 Nebraska (11/19/18) in Kansas City with 7 rebounds and 3 treys ... Named MVC Newcomer of the Week and College Sports Madness Conference Player of the Week on 11/12/18 after posting a pair of 20-point games and a double-double in his first week at the DI level, averaging 17.3 points and 8.3 rebounds ... Scored 20 points with 8 boards in win over Stetson (11/11/18) ... Drained 4-of-6 3-pointers and recorded his first career double-double with 20 points and 10 boards vs. Robert Morris (11/9/18) ... Notched 12 points and game-high 7 rebounds in season opener vs. Oral Roberts (11/6/18).

Odessa College

Ranked as the No. 76 player on the JucoRecruiting.com website for the class of 2018 ... Played two seasons for coach Tra Arnold’s squad at Odessa (Texas) College ... Was second on the team as a sophomore with 15.0 points per game and also averaged 5.4 rebounds and 1.8 assists while converting 78.9 percent of his team-high 147 free throw attempts in 2017-18 ... Also knocked down 33 3-pointers for a 28-5 Wranglers team as a sophomore ... Also posted 13.3 points per game in conference games in 2017-18 as part of Odessa’s 15-1 run to a league regular-season title ... During his freshman campaign at Odessa, Cook played in 31 games for a 28-6 squad and averaged 4.7 points and 1.8 rebounds off the bench while converting 75 percent of his free throw attempts and 52 percent of his field goals ... Averaged 10.0 points and 3.7 rebounds per game for his junior college career.

High School

Cook was an all-conference and second-team all-metro selection his senior season for coach Darnell Dantzler at Edmondson-Westside High in Baltimore ... Led the Red Storm to a 28-3 record, conference title and regional runner-up showing in 2014-15 while averaging 19.0 points per game ... Played three seasons at Northwestern High where he was part of a city championship team his junior year ... Averaged 21.5 points and earned all-conference distinction in 2013-14.

Personal

Keandre Cook was born 5/1/97 in Baltimore, Md. ... Son of Keith Cook and Carletta Reeves of Baltimore ... Has two brothers, Keith and Colby ... Majoring in Communication Studies.
